avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger above 2000 metres is rated as moderate (level 2), below that it is low. In particular, older snowdrift accumulations in the east and north sectors, especially behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls, can usually be triggered by large additional loads as medium slab avalanches.
Occasionally, wet loose snow slides are still possible from steep rocky and rugged terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unfavourable snow layering in the northern sector!

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow cover, snowpack has settled somewhat due to the warmth. In the high altitudes, older wind slab lies on angular forms in the northern and eastern exposures.  Weak layers are mainly found in the old snowpack (unstable layer of faceted crystals). In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability. On the sunny slopes, the lockout is progressing again.

tendency.highlights:
At the weekend, the high fog layer south of the Niedere Tauern and Hochschwab will become thicker, at least occasionally the mountain ranges will be covered in fog up to an altitude of 1500 metres. Sunny in the northern Alps with southerly foehn.
The avalanche danger is decreasing.

weatherForecast.comment:
The clouds from the weak disturbance will move eastwards in the evening and the night will often be clear. Friday will bring mainly sunny weather over the Styrian mountains, with only harmless clouds passing through in high layers. Any fog or high fog patches will dissipate in many places, only along the peripheral mountains could persistent high fog accumulate, but at least at altitudes above 600 to 900 metres, sunshine will once again predominate.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be between 0 and 3 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres will be around 4 degrees. Moderate winds with gusts of around 30 km/h from south-east to west.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is low.
In the extremely steep north-facing gullies at high altitudes, the possibility of a snow slab being triggered cannot be ruled out.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger. Poor snow layering on the north side!

snowpackStructure.comment: On the north side, the kinetic metamorphism weakens the snow base, fundament. Angular shapes or cup crystals form weak layers. If an avalanche is triggered in the northern sector, the snow cover, snowpack tears through to the ground.

tendency.highlights:
The avalanche danger remains low.
At the weekend, the high fog layer south of the Niedere Tauern and Hochschwab will become thicker, and at least occasionally the mountain ranges will be covered in fog up to an altitude of 1500 metres.

weatherForecast.comment:
The clouds from the weak disturbance will move eastwards in the evening and the night will often be clear. Friday will bring mainly sunny weather over the Styrian mountains, with only harmless clouds passing through in high layers. Any fog or high fog patches will dissipate in many places, only along the peripheral mountains could persistent high fog accumulate, but at least at altitudes above 600 to 900 metres, sunshine will once again predominate.
The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres will be between -1 and 2 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1000 metres will be between 0 and 3 degrees. There will be moderate winds with gusts of around 30 km/h from the south to north-west. The snowfall level will be between the valleys and around 1500 metres above sea level. No new fallen snow is expected.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Avalanche prone locations for slab avalanches are in the north and east sectors!
